title: How to Keep a Kitchen Towel Clean

steps.headline: Wash your new towels right away.
steps.description: A new kitchen towel has germs and chemicals in its fibers that are not easily visible. Wash it immediately with a high quality detergent to get required protection. Try to choose a chemical free detergent for this purpose. It must have antimicrobial additives that keep stains, bad odor and mildews away. Cotton towels are easy to wash and clean. They also remove dirt, stains and blemishes effectively. So try to choose them.

steps.headline: When you're washing your towels, make sure that you rinse them thoroughly to remove all types of stains.
steps.description: In order to kill germs, you can keep the towels in a microwave for some time.

steps.headline: Use hot water to wash your towels.
steps.description: Hot water helps to remove dirt, stain and blemishes from the root. Bleach or baking soda can be used to remove bad odor and make your towels smell fresh.

steps.headline: After washing your towels, dry them immediately to avoid germs.
steps.description: Some high quality towels are completely stain resistant and wrinkle free that don't need ironing; try buying these.

steps.headline: Use stain remover.
steps.description: In order to remove stains, you can apply stain cleaner on a stained area before washing the towel and then rinse it. Avoid softeners as they can reduce the absorption capacity of the towels.

steps.headline: Use the safest detergent.
steps.description: If you keep the towel soaked in hot water with detergent, then try to use only safe detergent and bleach that doesn't cause any damage to the fabric of the towel.

steps.headline: Keep your kitchen clean and germ free so your towels don't absorb the bad odor from their environment.
steps.description: Hang your towels in an open spot to air them out properly.
